title: This is a shot in the dark
text:
Hi, there,

I'm 28, employed, educated, non-insane, and looking to possibly date a solid guy around my age. Cross-posting this from a dating to CL is more of an experience than anything else. Hopefully, it doesn't end in my getting stabbed.

My self-summary:

I realized I was bi a little late in life (no, i wasn't just closeted). I didn't consider guys as a viable option because dating & sleeping with women was always there and a "lifestyle" I preferred. Plus, beyond hookups, the guys I've been romantically interested in have always been straight. I'm now single and looking to change that because, why not?

I'm not too interested in the gay scene, though I don't discriminate against those who are. I'm just not looking for a hand-holder to drag night at the Cockpit or what have you. I've glimpsed enough of that scene and it's not mine. "Straight" clubs aren't either; not a club guy.

I'm long-term relationship oriented, ideally, and the kind of guy that wants something good to come home to some day. I don't really feel like I need to be special or unique to feel like I'm worth something. Posting 10 selfies of yourself a day and counting the likes sounds exhausting to me.

What I'm doing with my life:

- Editor by day and writer by late nights with a few cups of coffee. Currently working on a novel after a pretty middling collection of short stories.

- Imminent dog owner. I realize that it's a commitment in the city, so I'm planning it carefully. Lots of park walks in my future.

- Education-wise, I have an undergraduate degree in Sociology & Econ from Columbia and a Masters in Writing.

- I've lived in Montreal, Toronto, Austin, New York.

- Huge TV and movie buff, which is what I studied and hope to one day work in. Have a dream and loose business plans for my own production studio one day. An MBA might be in order first.

"Misc."

My music preferences are all over the place, and I'm the type that gets infatuated with a song and plays it a hundred times before I get sick of it and never listen again.

Not a vegetarian, but try to eat healthy at least half the time. Burger and fries when I don't. I love sushi and Indian. I order Seamless way too much and am tying to become a better cook beyond 'omelet' and 'keylime pie' which is a strange portfolio.

Not a buff gym-rat. More of a zone-out-on-the-treadmill-4-times-a-week type on that front. I like running but currently, I only go to the gym out of shallow necessity. I'm trying to engage in more diverse activities on that front. Muy Thai classes is kicking my ass a few times a month and I want to take up wall-climbing.

"On a typical Friday night I am"

I usually spend Friday nights having dinner with a small group of friend. I'm never too dissapointed about staying in and watching Netflix either, to be honest.

"The most private thing I'm willing to admit:"

- Even with a healthy network of friends and acquaintances, and normal amount of sex, the city gets very lonely sometimes. It feels like all dating site profiles are built on hiding that fact with as many pictures of other people as possible.

- I also want a family one day... When I'm a grown-up. Not super sure what that will look like, or when, but there you go.

"You should message me if:"

- You're sane and sweet. I hate to say "masculine" because I'm not some lumberjack myself but I've never been attracted to effeminate guys. Just being honest. Hopefully, you're just genuine, grounded, and know who you are.

- I'm not too into the types of guys who are too focused on what's trendy and how to be unique as a way of coping with their own insecurity. I don't want to be (or be with) someone who lives their life as a reality show no one is watching.

- Sexually, versatile, but not looking to hook up. There are like 5 apps for that. Unfortunately, there's not one for grabbing a beer.

Again, this is an experience. If this isn't for you, don't message me.

All the best,

text:

I am (I think, and if I do say so myself), a very nice person, honest, sincere, and loyal. Life has had its bumps along the way, and at 60, I find myself alone, without a whole lot of money, and I would like to find a partner. I never thought I would be posting a CL ad but here it goes.

I'm a nice person, somewhat complicated. I usually mean well, but...
I use my mouth alot - I talk too much, I eat too much, and, well you can help with the other stuff. 
I am a great cook and a lousy housekeeper. I spend too much time indoors and would like to be out more. I like the woods over the beach. I would rather have root canal without anesthesia than sit through the Oscars. Although I am out to everyone in my life who matters, I am not at all into the "gay scene".

My ideal partner is (none of these are absolute requirements except the kissing and cuddling part, and they are not listed in any particular order.) :

A caucasian (white) male between the ages of 45 and 70.
very masculine demeanor, but genuine, not Mary Muscles with leather chaps.
a working man (currently unemployed or retired is o.k.)
comfortable with his sexuality.
friendly and respectful to all.
religious or spiritually oriented, or a tolerant atheist.
a nature lover.
an animal lover.
a guy who can fix things and maybe who can teach me those skills as well.
a kisser and a cuddler (required).
a good listener.
SINGLE and AVAILABLE for building a relationship. (This does not mean that you are in a "long term but sexless relationship" or that you and Evelyn are getting a divorce as soon as you find a new job.)
Horny as Hell with a strong libido, at the *top* of his game but with some versatility. I am NOT looking for a total bottom, or anyone who wants to be "submissive" or who wants a "daddy". 
A non-drug user and a non-alcoholic. (A few beers now and then is fine.)
Generous of spirit.
Someone who doesn't complain about everything. (I dated a NYPD officer once. He was great in many ways, but incessantly harping about his pension. Have a nice life, Sarge.)
Patient.
Vegetarians are nice, but not essential. (I eat very little meat, but I'm not a vegetarian either.)

I really don't care about your bank account, your house in the Bahamas, your stock portfolio, how often you go to the gym, or how many countries you have been to. On the other hand, I might care about the cat you rescued and gave to your niece, the last book you read, the cabin you are building in the Adirondacks, your French lessons, which days you work in the soup kitchen, or what the priest/minister/rabbi's sermon was about.

I don't mind if you are a cigarette smoker, although not in my house, please.

As for looks, etc., I am attracted to faces, but the faces I am attracted to are not necessarily those that others find classically handsome, and I find that most men have something to offer. So if you don't look like George Clooney, don't despair. On the other hand, if you do look like G.C., don't pass me up either! 

I am not particularly attracted to tattoos (they don't turn me off or on - they're just there, and I would never have one). Piercings in odd places DO turn me off, as does "manscaping" and stuff like leather harnesses, etc. Foreskins are nice. I am [literally] allergic to men's cologne.

I suppose I could ramble on and on, but perhaps I have already said too much.

title: This is a shot in the dark
text:
Hi, there,

I'm 28, employed, educated, non-insane, and looking to possibly date a solid guy around my age. Cross-posting this from a dating to CL is more of an experience than anything else. Hopefully, it doesn't end in my getting stabbed.

My self-summary:

I realized I was bi a little late in life (no, i wasn't just closeted). I didn't consider guys as a viable option because dating & sleeping with women was always there and a "lifestyle" I preferred. Plus, beyond hookups, the guys I've been romantically interested in have always been straight. I'm now single and looking to change that because, why not?

I'm not too interested in the gay scene, though I don't discriminate against those who are. I'm just not looking for a hand-holder to drag night at the Cockpit or what have you. I've glimpsed enough of that scene and it's not mine. "Straight" clubs aren't either; not a club guy.

I'm long-term relationship oriented, ideally, and the kind of guy that wants something good to come home to some day. I don't really feel like I need to be special or unique to feel like I'm worth something. Posting 10 selfies of yourself a day and counting the likes sounds exhausting to me.

What I'm doing with my life:

- Editor by day and writer by late nights with a few cups of coffee. Currently working on a novel after a pretty middling collection of short stories.

- Imminent dog owner. I realize that it's a commitment in the city, so I'm planning it carefully. Lots of park walks in my future.

- Education-wise, I have an undergraduate degree in Sociology & Econ from Columbia and a Masters in Writing.

- I've lived in Montreal, Toronto, Austin, New York.

- Huge TV and movie buff, which is what I studied and hope to one day work in. Have a dream and loose business plans for my own production studio one day. An MBA might be in order first.

"Misc."

My music preferences are all over the place, and I'm the type that gets infatuated with a song and plays it a hundred times before I get sick of it and never listen again.

Not a vegetarian, but try to eat healthy at least half the time. Burger and fries when I don't. I love sushi and Indian. I order Seamless way too much and am tying to become a better cook beyond 'omelet' and 'keylime pie' which is a strange portfolio.

Not a buff gym-rat. More of a zone-out-on-the-treadmill-4-times-a-week type on that front. I like running but currently, I only go to the gym out of shallow necessity. I'm trying to engage in more diverse activities on that front. Muy Thai classes is kicking my ass a few times a month and I want to take up wall-climbing.

"On a typical Friday night I am"

I usually spend Friday nights having dinner with a small group of friend. I'm never too dissapointed about staying in and watching Netflix either, to be honest.

"The most private thing I'm willing to admit:"

- Even with a healthy network of friends and acquaintances, and normal amount of sex, the city gets very lonely sometimes. It feels like all dating site profiles are built on hiding that fact with as many pictures of other people as possible.

- I also want a family one day... When I'm a grown-up. Not super sure what that will look like, or when, but there you go.

"You should message me if:"

- You're sane and sweet. I hate to say "masculine" because I'm not some lumberjack myself but I've never been attracted to effeminate guys. Just being honest. Hopefully, you're just genuine, grounded, and know who you are.

- I'm not too into the types of guys who are too focused on what's trendy and how to be unique as a way of coping with their own insecurity. I don't want to be (or be with) someone who lives their life as a reality show no one is watching.

- Sexually, versatile, but not looking to hook up. There are like 5 apps for that. Unfortunately, there's not one for grabbing a beer.

Again, this is an experience. If this isn't for you, don't message me.

All the best,

title: This is a shot in the dark
text:
Hi, there,

I'm 28, employed, educated, non-insane, and looking to possibly date a solid guy around my age. Cross-posting this from a dating to CL is more of an experience than anything else. Hopefully, it doesn't end in my getting stabbed.

My self-summary:

I realized I was bi a little late in life (no, i wasn't just closeted). I didn't consider guys as a viable option because dating & sleeping with women was always there and a "lifestyle" I preferred. Plus, beyond hookups, the guys I've been romantically interested in have always been straight. I'm now single and looking to change that because, why not?

I'm not too interested in the gay scene, though I don't discriminate against those who are. I'm just not looking for a hand-holder to drag night at the Cockpit or what have you. I've glimpsed enough of that scene and it's not mine. "Straight" clubs aren't either; not a club guy.

I'm long-term relationship oriented, ideally, and the kind of guy that wants something good to come home to some day. I don't really feel like I need to be special or unique to feel like I'm worth something. Posting 10 selfies of yourself a day and counting the likes sounds exhausting to me.

What I'm doing with my life:

- Editor by day and writer by late nights with a few cups of coffee. Currently working on a novel after a pretty middling collection of short stories.

- Imminent dog owner. I realize that it's a commitment in the city, so I'm planning it carefully. Lots of park walks in my future.

- Education-wise, I have an undergraduate degree in Sociology & Econ from Columbia and a Masters in Writing.

- I've lived in Montreal, Toronto, Austin, New York.

- Huge TV and movie buff, which is what I studied and hope to one day work in. Have a dream and loose business plans for my own production studio one day. An MBA might be in order first.

"Misc."

My music preferences are all over the place, and I'm the type that gets infatuated with a song and plays it a hundred times before I get sick of it and never listen again.

Not a vegetarian, but try to eat healthy at least half the time. Burger and fries when I don't. I love sushi and Indian. I order Seamless way too much and am tying to become a better cook beyond 'omelet' and 'keylime pie' which is a strange portfolio.

Not a buff gym-rat. More of a zone-out-on-the-treadmill-4-times-a-week type on that front. I like running but currently, I only go to the gym out of shallow necessity. I'm trying to engage in more diverse activities on that front. Muy Thai classes is kicking my ass a few times a month and I want to take up wall-climbing.

"On a typical Friday night I am"

I usually spend Friday nights having dinner with a small group of friend. I'm never too dissapointed about staying in and watching Netflix either, to be honest.

"The most private thing I'm willing to admit:"

- Even with a healthy network of friends and acquaintances, and normal amount of sex, the city gets very lonely sometimes. It feels like all dating site profiles are built on hiding that fact with as many pictures of other people as possible.

- I also want a family one day... When I'm a grown-up. Not super sure what that will look like, or when, but there you go.

"You should message me if:"

- You're sane and sweet. I hate to say "masculine" because I'm not some lumberjack myself but I've never been attracted to effeminate guys. Just being honest. Hopefully, you're just genuine, grounded, and know who you are.

- I'm not too into the types of guys who are too focused on what's trendy and how to be unique as a way of coping with their own insecurity. I don't want to be (or be with) someone who lives their life as a reality show no one is watching.

- Sexually, versatile, but not looking to hook up. There are like 5 apps for that. Unfortunately, there's not one for grabbing a beer.

Again, this is an experience. If this isn't for you, don't message me.

All the best,

title: looking for a friendly bi couple
text:
